website_summaries.verdict: All-natural product that soothes irritated skin and closes nicks from shaving.
pros: Provides a good value per ounce, as you’ll receive two alum blocks in one order
Versatile product that’s a good choice for toning the skin or serving as a deodorant
Works best as a pre-shave application for electric shaving or as a post-shave application for mechanical shaving
Sourced from France for a high level of quality
cons: Five-plus ounces of product may be more than some people need

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff
customer_reviews.text: I am a beginning straight razor shaver. I bought this alum after reading that it helps with razor burn. The first time I used it, my face burned like fire, and I questioned why anyone would use it, it seemed to make the razor burn much worse. This turns out to be an indication of improper shaving technique. After adjusting my technique, the razor burn went away. Now when I apply alum after shaving, there is a mild sting for a few seconds and then it's good to go. I rinse it off after it dries, and then apply some diluted Cerave hand lotion. This combination gives a very smooth, irritation free shave.
customer_reviews.author: Bill W. Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Solid and long-lasting
customer_reviews.text: The Osma alum blocks are more expensive than most others, but they are well worth the extra cost. These are solid blocks of alum, not compressed granules like other brands. This means the Osma blocks last longer and the surface of the block stays smooth. Definitely worth it for the shaver who wants to regularly use alum in his or her shaving routine. Top notch product.
customer_reviews.author: Eastern Hound

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended

I say all that to say I like that it leaves that tight, dry feeling. Just giving another view point.
